name: Test
body:
## Plot Types
Five plot types of original ggplot2 are supported in ggplot2.sparkR now. More types will be updated.

### Geoms
Geoms, short for geometric objects, describe the type of plot you will produce.

* geom_bar
* geom_bin2d
* geom_boxplot
* geom_freqpoly
* geom_histogram

### Statistics
It’s often useful to transform your data before plotting, and that’s what statistical transformations do.

* stat_bin
* stat_bin2d
* stat_boxplot
* stat_sum

## Examples
The parameter **_data_** in examples can be either R data.frame or Spark DataFrame.

If the input data is Spark DataFrame, heavyweight data processing stages are offloaded to the Spark backend using the SparkR API.

### 1. geom_bar
Bars, rectangles with bases on x-axis

```R
ggplot(data, aes(x = Item, fill = Payment)) + geom_bar()
```
![image of bar chart](https://moonkyung.github.io/Test/bar.png)

### 2. geom_histogram
Histogram. Bars, rectangles with bases on x-axis using continuous data.

```R
ggplot(data, aes(x = Price)) + geom_histogram(binwidth = 10)
```
![image of bar chart](https://moonkyung.github.io/Test/hist.png)

### 3. stat_sum
Sum unique values. Useful for overplotting on scatterplots.

```R
ggplot(data, aes(x = Item, y = Payment)) + stat_sum()
```
![image of bar chart](https://moonkyung.github.io/Test/stat_sum.png)

### 4. geom_bin2d
Add heatmap of 2d bin counts.

```R
ggplot(data, aes(x = Item, y = Price)) + geom_bin2d()
```
![image of bar chart](https://moonkyung.github.io/Test/bin2d.png)


### 5. geom_boxplot
Calculate components of box and whisker plot.

```R
ggplot(data, aes(x = Item, y = Price)) + geom_boxplot()
```
![image of bar chart](https://moonkyung.github.io/Test/box.png)
